subject: Creativity
title: Rules Kill Creativity: When Structure Actually Helps
description: One-minute skill: Rules Kill Creativity: When Structure Actually Helps.

hook.text: Sonnets have 14 lines, strict meter, and a rhyme scheme. These constraints produced Shakespeare's greatest poetry.

buildup.text: The myth says rules and structure are creativity's enemies. But every art form has rules: music has scales.

climax.text: Even 'rule-breaking' art requires knowing the rules first. Picasso mastered realistic painting before inventing Cubism.

punchline.text: Rules don't cage creativity. They give it a jungle gym to climb.

quiz.question: Why is jazz considered evidence that rules help creativity?
options: Jazz musicians improvise WITHIN strict rules of chord progressions and scales
